pageContext.claim: “So, Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador have done nothing. Mexico has done nothing.”
pageContext.analysis: Mexico has offered asylum and jobs to migrants from Central America. Before Trump's comment, U..S. officials held up El Salvador as proof that foreign aid could help curb migration. The partnership between the two countries drew praise from diplomats, members of Congress and even America’s top border enforcement official. In the past three years, both El Salvador’s homicide rate and migration flows have declined sharply. More than 72,000 Salvadorans were apprehended crossing the U.S. border in 2016. By 2018, the number had plummeted by more than half, to fewer than 32,000.
